basics.name: Saurabh Farkya
basics.label: Advanced ML Scientist
basics.summary: I am an Advanced Machine Learning researcher at the Center for Vision Technology at Stanford Research Institute (SRI), focusing on edge AI, adaptive and continual learning, federated learning, and hardware-software co-design, with an emphasis on efficient ML, privacy, and security for edge devices. Actively developing closed-loop systems to enhance human-machine collaboration and Large Language Models (LLMs) for military strategic applications.

work.name: Center for Vision Technology (CVT), Stanford Research Institute (SRI)
highlights: Edge AI, adaptive and continual learning, federated learning, hardware-software co-design.
Developing closed-loop systems to enhance human-machine collaboration and LLMs for military strategic applications.
Multiple patents and publications in Edge AI and ML advancements.

work.name: Center for Research in Computer Vision (CRCV), University of Central Florida
highlights: Worked on large-scale re-identification of cars across multiple cameras.
Contributed to detection and tracking demos for the DIVA challenge.
Mentored students in Keras and CV fundamentals during REU summer school program.

work.name: Vision Lab, Neuroscience, Indian Institute of Science (IISc)
highlights: Developed computational models for visual search tasks.
Assisted in data collection for the Perceptual Priming study.

work.name: Signal Processing Lab, NIT Nagpur
highlights: Worked on Devanagari Handwritten Character Recognition and Text-to-Speech system.
Collected dataset, developed adaptive segmentation, and speech generation process.

projects.name: REECAR - Resilient and Energy Efficient Computing ARchitecture
projects.description: Comprehensive framework for Edge AI deployment and adaptation, developed federated training algorithms, and quantization framework for hardware efficiency.

roles.name: Federated Learning for heterogeneous devices
roles.description: Developed algorithms for multi-task learning and privacy, achieving 10x training FLOPs efficiency.

roles.name: Quantization Framework
roles.description: Designed post-Qn and hardware-aware Qn schemes for model efficiency.

roles.name: Training Algorithms for Online Edge Learning
roles.description: Extended backpropagation-free algorithms to GNNs and studied their convergence.

projects.name: SAGADE - Self-Attention over Graphs for Anticipatory Detections at the Edge
projects.description: Developed a compressed detector model for visual tracking using saliency-based gating, improving energy efficiency.
roles: Achieved 20x improvement in Energy Delay Product (EDP) and minimized power consumption.

projects.name: MACD - Machine Assisted Co-Active Design for Human-Machine Teaming
projects.description: Developing human-machine teaming frameworks with LLMs for military strategy.

projects.name: HyDRATE - Hyper-Dimensional Reconfigurable Analytics at the Tactical Edge
projects.description: Developed a hardware-software co-design system for edge computing with reconfigurable AI capabilities.

projects.name: MEDIQ - Moving Ensembles with Diversity through Information and Quantization
projects.description: Ensemble defense framework against adversarial attacks using MI estimators.

volunteer.summary: Guided students, provided feedback on assignments, and facilitated discussions.
